title: Open Mail Relay Identified
overview: <paragraph>An open mail relay is an SMTP server configured in such a way that it allows anyone on the Internet to send e-mail through it, not just mail destined to or originating from known users [1]. The risk to <<CUSTOMER>> is in the form of corporate integrity. Furthermore, <<CUSTOMER>> IPs maybe listed blacklisted as a SPAM host or malicious source. </paragraph><paragraph>There is no business value in an Open Mail Relay.</paragraph>
